snippet: Regulators will examine sexual harassment charges against Assemblyman Vito J. Lopez, but not the use of public money by the Assembly speaker, Sheldon Silver, to settle some.
abstract: New York State Joint Commission on Ethics decides not to authorize a full-fledged investigation of the use of public money by Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver to finance a confidential settlement with two woman charging Assemblyman Vito J Lopez with sexual harassment; commission opts to focus its inquiry more narrowly on Lopez, whose conduct is already under investigation by prosecutors in New York City and Albany.
lead_paragraph: Regulators will examine sexual harassment charges against Assemblyman Vito J. Lopez, but not the use of public money by the Assembly speaker, Sheldon Silver, to settle some.

headline.seo: Albany Ethics Panel to Focus on Assemblyman Lopez, Not Silver
headline.main: New York Ethics Inquiry Won’t Look at Speaker’s Actions
headline.print_headline: State Ethics Panel Opts Not to Investigate Speaker’s Role in Lopez Case
